text: Chad at the Olympics is a history which includes 11 games in 10 countries and 20+ athletes.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), "Chad" ; retrieved 2012-8-16. Since 1964, athletes of Chad have been part of the "Olympic Movement".Olympics.org, "Factsheet: The Olympic Movement"; retrieved 2012-7-28. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Chad is CHA."Abbreviations, National Olympic Committees," 2009 Annual Report, p. 90 [PDF p. 91 of 94]; retrieved 2012-10-12. In 1964, it was CHD. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== The Chad National Olympic Committee was formed in 1963. The Comit√© Olympique et Sportif Tchadien. was recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) in 1964.Olympic.org, Chad; retrieved 2012-8-16. A team from Chad has been at every Summer Olympic Games held between 1964 and 1972 and from 1984 to 2008. Chad has not sent a team to any Winter Olympic Games. ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes == References == ==Other websites == * Chad profile at London2012.com Category:Chad Category:Nations at the Olympics
title: Chad at the Olympics
